summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2006 CHEVROLET COBALT.  THE CONTACT WAS DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 50 MPH ON NORMAL ROAD CONDITIONS.  THERE WAS A SUDDEN LOSS OF POWER STEERING.  THE STEERING WHEEL REQUIRED GREATER FORCE TO  TURN.  THE DRIVER PULLED OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD WITH CAUTION.  THE ENGINE WAS TURNED OFF.  THE VEHICLE RESTARTED AND RESUMED TO NORMAL OPERATION FOR A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME.  THE FAILURE WAS INTERMITTENT AND PROGRESSED WHENEVER THE VEHICLE WAS IN OPERATION.   THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. THE FAILURE WAS CONTRIBUTED TO THE ELECTRIC POWER STEERING MOTOR.  THE VEHICLE IS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING REPAIRED FOR THE MALFUNCTION.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 85,000.  THE VIN WAS REJECTED FROM THE SYSTEM.
